page.title: 13BIOGRAPHY
page.content: A DAY IN MY LFE. ALICE GLADWIN. 10. At seven thirty in the morning my clock radio wakes me up. I then stay in bed until eight o'clock. Then I get out of bed and get dressed. I like wearing dark clothes which include skirt, blouse, thin tights and slip-on shoes. I go downstairs and eat my breakfast which is usually a ceral called Weetabix. It comes in a yellow packet. Then I go back upstairs to the bathroom to brush my teeth. I return to get my coat and glasses which I need to see clearly, and then walk to school. At school we hang our coats up in the cloakroom. Girls are separate from boys. Then we walk across the hall to our classroom. We work all morning apart from a short break at 10.30. I prefer a packed lunch because I don't like the school dinners provided.
